report_title: Industry Report on National Parks and Other Nature Institutions
executive_summary: National parks and other nature institutions include operators engaged in the preservation and exhibition of natural areas or settings. Industry revenue is based on self-generated revenue, including admission fees, on-premise concession and accommodation sales and private donations and grants. Over the five years to 2023, steady visitor rates and a surge in environmental awareness kept revenue afloat. The COVID-19 pandemic significantly dampened profit during the period, so the reopening of the economy since then has significantly helped this industry, with revenue growth reaching 8.5% in 2021 alone.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Over the past five years, tight budgets have forced some operators to close entirely, while others have reduced operating hours or services to make up for decreased or inadequate funding. Industry operators have increased or introduced admission fees or have bolstered on-site product and service offerings, resulting in revenue gains. Still, many have struggled with rising operational costs, with the largest industry operator, the National Park Service, reporting an $18.0 billion deficit.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Covid-19 Pandemic Significantly Affected Industry Operations
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: During the COVID-19 pandemic's height, many operators were forced to temporarily close their establishments or operate at a limited capacity. Larger operators, such as the NPS, attract consumers from across the globe. Consumers traveling long distances to visit an industry establishment are more likely to spend greater sums on costly industry services, like on-site accommodations, guided tours and events. As a result, nonlocal day trip visitors and overnight visitors have historically accounted for more than three-quarters of industry revenue.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Tourist Visits to Industry Establishments are Forecast to Rise Steadily
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The environmental movement and the rising popularity of eco-tourism are expected to bolster visitor attendance moving forward. Increasing per capita disposable income in the period will also enable more Americans to go on vacations, including overnight visits to parks. This will likely increase spending per visit, as overnight travelers make more impulse purchases, buy expensive souvenirs and food and splurge on luxury services, like boat and helicopter tours.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: The Number of School Trips Will Likely Increase and Boost Revenue Growth
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: School field trips made to national parks have continued to aid this industry as these trips help generate demand from many educational services in the country. The COVID-19 pandemic has put a brief halt to this sector of the industry as schools were similarly shut down for the year or were put on a very restricted schedule that prevented these field trips from happening. With the reopening of all aspects of the country including K-12 schools in 2021, demand for this industry will return to pre-pandemic levels.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Companies Will Be Forced To Deal With Growing Debts
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The industry is expected to experience an increase in demand over the next five years, as consumers resume regular travel plans and disposable income increases. Operators are anticipated to experience mounting competition from other forms of entertainment and leisure. Industry establishments have long been viewed as a budget-friendly alternative for vacations and day trips. mounting deficits and rising operational costs have forced many operators to enact or raise admission fees, a trend that is forecast to become even more prevalent over the next five years.

industry_definition: The National Parks and Other Nature Institutions industry includes operators engaged in the preservation and exhibition of natural areas or settings.

opportunities: High Performance Drivers - Domestic trips by US residents
threats: Time spent on leisure and sports

key_trends: The National Parks and Other Nature Institutions industry includes operators engaged in the preservation and exhibition of natural areas or settings. Operators include national parks, wildlife sanctuaries and other natural wonder tourist attractions.

Strong economic trends including rising per capita disposable income will likely help increase consumer spending at national parks. Moreover, both domestic and international travel is set to grow in the next five years as more consumers return to traveling again at a consistent capacity.
National parks and other nature institutions receive a moderate level of industry assistance. Most establishments are considered nonprofit entities and have a tax exemption status.
Industry-generated revenue is vital to the functioning of many national parks. Still, many operators rely in large part on government funding to keep their establishments operational.

The size and scope of services offered by operators in the National Parks and Other Nature Institutions industry vary significantly. For all industry operators, revenue is calculated based on self-generated funds and private donations and grants, admission and membership fees, tours and educational services, concession and entertainment fees, plus various other services.
National parks and other nature institutions are generally concentrated in regions with the highest share of the US population.

The National Parks and Other Nature Institutions industry experiences a moderate level of market share concentration. Over the past five years, the industry's market share concentration decreased at a regular pace.
The National Parks Service (NPS) is by far the largest industry operator. The industry's market share concentration is largely driven by the performance of the NPS.

Cost structure can vary significantly between operators. National parks and other nature institutions are managed on various scales of operation, and costs defer based on the type and specific needs of a park.

tier_1_suppliers: Heavy Equipment Rental in the US
Tool & Equipment Rental in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: The number of domestic trips is recovering from a recession-related decline. Higher disposable incomes have made leisure travel possible for a growing number of Americans.
An increase in international arrivals by foreigners typically leads to more visits to industry establishments.
With greater discretionary income, consumers are more likely to visit parks that charge entrance fees and spend a greater amount per visit.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Time Spent on Leisure and Sports
demand_determinants.determinant_description: An increase in available leisure time for Americans encourages participation in activities performed in industry establishments.

regulations_points.regulation_title: Regulations for the Conservation of Fauna, Flora and Natural Resources
regulations_points.regulation_description: There are heavy penalties associated with the destruction, tampering or unauthorized removal of any flora or fauna or culturally significant artifacts.
There are important regulations regarding scientific and other research activities, especially in regard to waste management.
There is strict regulation over the more extreme activities that can happen in a park or nature center.

barriers_points.barrier_description: The significant investments required to maintain and update infrastructure.

basis_points.basis_title: The National Parks and Other Nature Institutions industry experiences a moderate level of market share concentration.
basis_points.basis_description: Over the past five years, the industry's market share concentration decreased at a regular pace.

basis_points.basis_title: The National Parks Service (NPS) is by far the largest industry operator.
basis_points.basis_description: The industry's market share concentration is largely driven by the performance of NPS.

concentration_points.concentration_title: SOME NATIONAL PARKS AND OTHER NATURE INSTITUTIONS RECEIVE MORE INVESTMENT AND DONATIONS THAN OTHERS
concentration_points.concentration_description: The majority of parks are nonprofit organizations.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Depreciation Causes Operators to Struggle in Maintaining Infrastructure
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Operators spend a significant amount of funding on capital outlays, like equipment for building or road maintenance.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Supplies Used to Maintain the Appearance of Parks Accounts for the Largest Purchase Costs
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Goods sold at gift shops and convenience stores that operate on-premises include packaged food and beverages.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: The significant investments required to maintain and update infrastructure.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Individual Spending on Services Remains Consistent
volatility_points.volatility_description: Industry services are considered a low-cost entertainment option.

FAQs.question: How does your company combat competition over customers' attention from alternative forms of entertainment?
FAQs.answer: Many cash-strapped consumers prefer establishments with low or pay-as-you-wish admission fees, or establishments void of admission fees.
